The original paper map was scanned, georeferenced, and rectified to broaden access and to facilitate use in GIS software.</abstract><purpose>This georectified digital map was created for the purpose of facilitating discovery and use in GIS systems.  The positional accuracy of this map is limited.  The map is intended for viewing and not for measurements or calculations.  No responsibility is assumed by the Idaho Geospatial Data Clearinghouse or the University of Idaho in the use of these data.</purpose></descript><timeperd><current>publication date</current><timeinfo><rngdates><begdate>1858</begdate><enddate>1863</enddate></rngdates></timeinfo></timeperd><keywords><theme><themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt><themekey>imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</themekey></theme><theme><themekey>Military Road</themekey><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>Historic Map</themekey><themekey>Fort Walla Walla</themekey><themekey>Fort Benton</themekey></theme></keywords><natvform Sync="TRUE">Raster Dataset</natvform><spdom><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">-13564828.496067</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">-12149912.453317</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">5520926.180830</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">6368033.125122</topbc></lboundng><bounding><westbc Sync="TRUE">-121.854928</westbc><eastbc Sync="TRUE">-109.144521</eastbc><northbc Sync="TRUE">49.546082</northbc><southbc Sync="TRUE">44.357451</southbc></bounding></spdom></idinfo><metainfo><metc><cntinfo><cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype><address>1031 N. georeference the map were created using the 1:100:000-scale Digital Raster Graphics Footprints layer.  Using the Georeferencing Toolbar in ArcGIS 10.0 SP1, control points were placed using a map scale of approximately 1:75,000 with the data frame spatial reference set to GCS North American 1927.  A '3nd Order Polynomial' transformation was applied and the image was rectified.  The data frame was set to WGS 1984 Web Mercator (Auxiliary Sphere) when the image was rectified.
